avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size once again. The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence. In isolated cases the dry avalanches are large and can be released by a single winter sport participant, caution is to be exercised in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas above approximately 2200 m.
Avalanches can penetrate deep layers and reach quite a large size.
The avalanche prone locations are sometimes covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility. This applies in particular along the border with France. The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. Some snow will fall until midday along the border with France. The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow.
Faceted weak layers exist deeper in the old snowpack in particular on shady slopes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the strong wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent. The fresh snow and very particularly the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
In particular on very steep slopes and at the base of rock walls medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.
Backcountry touring calls for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days must be evaluated with care and prudence at high altitude. As a consequence of warming moist avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 30 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 1500 m.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
The high temperatures from the early morning will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the wind slabs will increase in size. The fresh snow and very particularly the resulting wind slabs can be released easily, or, in isolated cases naturally above the tree line, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Dry avalanches can in isolated cases be triggered in the old snowpack and reach quite a large size in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls. This also applies in areas where the snow cover is rather shallow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Up to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Sunday. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak. In some places wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The sometimes strong wind will transport the new snow. The fresh snow and very particularly the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases at high altitude, especially on very steep slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
On very steep shady slopes the avalanches can be released in the old snow and reach medium size.
As a consequence of warming small to medium-sized moist avalanches are possible below approximately 2000 m.
Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger. As a consequence of warming moist avalanches are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust. Towards its base, the snowpack is faceted and weak.
In high Alpine regions snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
In all altitude zones only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year.
